characters.introStart: Let's start with the basics. The bartender should know some stuff.
characters.name: Bartender

intro.question: Hey there. You don’t mind if I take a seat, now do you?
segments: Hmm? Go right ahead.

intro.question: I reckon you have heard about the murders happening around here.
segments: I’ve heard some things.

characters.introTransition: Time to learn a few things.

dialogues.question: Have you heard anything about the killer? Like, what he looks like?
segments: Nothing out of the ordinary.
He's probably made it as far as he has because he can stay hidden.

dialogues.question: This idiot have a name?
segments: I’m afraid I don’t know that much.

characters.questionsTransition: Seems like this is all I’m going to get.

outro.question: You sure know a lot.
segments: I do run the bar here, you know.
I think the only other person here as much as I am is the custodian.

outro.question: Good chat. Thanks for the drink
segments: Come again now, you hear?

characters.outroTransition: The custodian, huh. I'll talk to him next.

characters.name: Custodian

intro.question: That’s a fine cleaning job you’re doing.
segments: What of it? What do you want?

intro.question: The kind fellow working the bar told me about you. I’d like to know a few things.
segments: Woah there, man. That’s not how you strike up a conversation.

intro.question: How about this? I'll buy you a drink, your pick.
segments: Oh, alright, alright. Get me the most expensive one. Then we can get started.

characters.introTransition: Time to learn a few things

dialogues.question: Let’s get straight to it. What do you know about the murders?
segments: I should have known this wasn't idle chitchat.
The murderer might be a customer here.

dialogues.question: And how would you know?
segments: I... Man, if you didn't buy me the best damn drink.
I know of the murderer.

dialogues.question: Let's hear it.
segments: He goes by Jones. A friend of his would come and keep me company while I work my butt off.

outro.question: Anything else you’d like to share?
segments: Afraid that's all I know.

outro.question: Thank you. Enjoy your drink, friend.
segments: If you need to squeeze some info out of someone else, that guy at the bar comes here often.
I need to get back to work.

characters.outroTransition: Hmmm… why him? Let’s see what he’s got.

characters.name: Frequent Customer
characters.introStart: He looks pretty unoccupied. Now's probably the best time.

intro.question: Ah, that’s a good beer you’ve got there.
segments: You’ve got good taste, my friend. Take a seat.

characters.introTransition: Time to learn a few things

dialogues.question: This is an uneasy time. The murders are giving me chills.
segments: Murders you say?
I guess I've heard some chatter.

dialogues.question: I had a chat with the custodian earlier. He knew of the killer, and thought you would know some things.
segments: Yes, I do know a little. I take it you want me to share.

dialogues.question: You must know something then?
segments: Another guy, a friend of a friend told me some things.
The other day, he mentioned this murderer. Said he seemed a little out of place.

dialogues.question: Care to elaborate?
segments: He seemed a little odd, but he didn’t feel like the criminal-type.

dialogues.question: Any specifics?
segments: I've heard his name was Jackson.

dialogues.question: What does your friend do?
segments: My friend’s friend, you mean? He works for the NYPD.

characters.questionsTransition: Hmm... This will do for now.

outro.question: “Sounds like your friend knows quite a bit about this.
segments: I guess that’s one way to put it.
And he’s a friend of a friend. Get it right.

outro.question: I understand. Where can I find him?
segments: “He will probably be at his office.
Let me write you his name and work address.
You sure ask a lot of questions...

characters.outroTransition: Let me write this here… perfect. It’s time to boogie.
